title.narrative: Operation and Maintenance for Haj Ali Camp, Set up of Water Network for 3,100 plots within Haj Ali Camp, Ninewa governorate

description.narrative:
Haj Ali Camp has been set up in cooperation between several NGO’s and under IOM’s supervision. Currently RIRP is realizing the provision for WASH facilities for 2,400 plots while it is planned that ICRC will be providing and installing WASH facilities for the remaining 3,100 plots. The WASH facilities for the first 2,000 plots have been provided by KURDS and Murtaqa. At this point in time (February 2017) around 1,800 families are already inhabiting the camp and it is to be expected that the remaining plots will be filled very quickly. The total capacity of the camp is 7,500 plots for the same number of families. This project proposal is focusing on the provision of OampM services for the duration of 6 months, this will ensure that all WASH facilities are maintained and correctly functioning and that water is being provided for all the families. The OampM activities within the frame of this proposal include: Garbage collection and the provision of garbage bins Cleaning workers for the cleaning of toilets and showers Sewage desludging of sanitation facilities Maintenance of Sanitation/WASH Facilities (toilets and showers, water tanks, water network, OampM of generator and pumps) Provision of Hygiene Kits Hygiene Promotion (Trainers and visibility materials) Provision of fuel to run the generator that transports water from the Water Treatment Plant to the Camp Provision of garbage bags Provision of drinking water bottles (if needed during transition period) Water Trucking (if needed during transition period) Chlorine Tablets (if needed during transition period)
As planned at this point in time (01.03.2017) ICRC is realizing partial WASH facilities for the remaining 3,100 plots but are not installing the water network for this part of the camp, RIRP is proposing to realize this water network, therefore the costs for this constitute a part of this proposal. Important Note: ICRC are currently rehabilitating the Water Treatment Plant which is close to the camp, the works should be finished in around three weeks (around the 21.03.2017). ICRC will also take care of the pipe connection between the Water Treatment Plant and the Camp as the existing one is severely damaged and does not allow the required water pressure needed to provide the whole camp and the host community with water. Unless this pipe connection is established the water network in the camp cannot be fully utilised.
